resources.string: Are you sure you want to continue?
The master password is too short
The master password does not match the one entered initially

It looks like you are using Keysaver for the first time. To get started, enter a new master password. It will be used to generate all new passwords and encrypt the database. The minimum length of the master password is 8 characters. It must contain both lowercase and uppercase letters, at least one digit, and at least one special character. The master password cannot be recovered, so make sure to remember it well!
A service with this name has already been saved earlier
A service with this URL has already been saved earlier
A configuration with this name already exists
The service has been successfully deleted
The service has been successfully updated
One of the required fields is empty
An encrypted copy of the current database will be saved. You assume the risks of a potential leak of this file. Do you want to continue?
The current database will be erased. After the import, the application will be closed. Do you want to continue?
Either uppercase or lowercase must be selected
The master password must contain at least one uppercase letter
The master password must contain at least one lowercase letter
The master password must contain at least one digit
The master password must contain at least one special character
The master password must contain both lowercase and uppercase letters, at least one digit, and one special character.

To proceed, you need to save at least one service. 
Enter the service URL – it is used for password generation. 
Enter the service name – this is how it will be displayed in the service list. 
Then, choose a password generation configuration (length, character set, etc.) from the created configurations.

Creating a Configuration. 
When creating a new configuration, keep in mind the following restrictions:
 - Password length must be between 8 and 30 characters (Default: 16)
 - The number of special characters, as well as digits, cannot exceed a quarter of the total password length.

You can change the displayed service name and the password configuration used for generating the service password.\nKeep in mind that if you modify the password configuration, the newly generated password WILL NOT match the old one.
Password Generation.\nSelect the service for which you need a password.\nClick on the image to generate the password.
